results.title: Gopal's golden pendant: India
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Looks at a family in Jaipur, India, whose members are master craftsmen in the art of enamelling gold and silver. In particular, the film focuses on a ten-year-old boy who has been learning the craft since he was six. Suitable for lower secondary level.

group_works.title: To Sing Our Own Song: Philippines

results.title: To Sing Our Own Song: Philippines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World about Us: Third Eye”.
One of a series of programs in which individuals describe the developing countries in which they live. Josae Diokno, former Secretary of Justice in the Philippines’ government is a victim of his outspoken views. A leading intellectual figure of dissent in the Third World, he spent two years in jail for hostile criticism of the martial law imposed by President Marcos.

results.title: Up the Amazon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
The world’s greatest river, the Amazon, rises high in the Andes and flows for four thousand miles to the Atlantic Ocean. It is surrounded by the vast Amazon forest, which is seen by scientists as the world’s oxygen factory, and by Brazilians as a frontier to be conquered. The forest is being exploited and luxury hotels are being built throughout the hitherto impenetrable jungle. An interesting contrast between the “tourist” Amazon and the natural river and its surroundings. Narrated by Frank Windsor.

results.title: The Desert dreamers (A)
results.creator_credit: Geoff Dunlop and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A video about the paintings produced by the Papunya Aboriginal people, some 200 miles from Alice Springs. Looking like twentieth century abstracts, the paintings use an extremely complex symbolic language that relates to religious ceremonies. Some of them are outstandingly beautiful. All reveal the richness of desert Aboriginal life and culture. Shows the lives of the painters and their families, desert nomads who are being forced to come to terms with the realities of white technology, economics and values.

results.title: Crocodile
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Christopher Parsons, Don Murray, British Broadcasting Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A comprehensive treatment of saltwater and freshwater crocodiles. A ‘non-specialist’ film, it is nevertheless scientifically accurate, and takes a balanced view of this little understood and seldom loved reptile, which is now in danger of extinction. Narrated by Hugh Falkus. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Christopher Parsons, Don Murray, British Broadcasting Corporation and Film Australia

results.title: A Prospect of Kew
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
Richard Mabey goes beyond the showpiece attractions of the Kew Gardens in Surrey to reveal how its two centuries of history and its scientific research has made it the international centre for plant conservation.
